About Treating Data / Query Language

What is Data, Gatsby's data layer , pull data?, unstructured data, query language , grapthQL

Data in Gatsby

  • “everything that lives outside a React component” is treated as data in Gatsby
  • Text and images written on the page
  • Markdown, CSV, etc. as well as databases and APIs

Treating Data

  • store data outside components and then bring the data into the component as needed
  • the data for the site (pages and posts) are in WordPress and you pull that data, as needed, into your components
  • Gatsby’s data layer lets you pull data from these (and any other source) directly into your components—in the shape and form you want.
  • What is unstructured data?

GraphQL

the Query Language for Gatsby

  • Gatsby uses GraphQL to pull data into components.
  • GraphQL is a Query Language
  • If not using GraphQL, then createPages would be okay.(for small site)

Pull Data into Components

  • Using a special syntax(which is query language), you describe the data you want in your component and then that data is given to you.
  • Gatsby uses GraphQL to pull data into components.
  • Gatsby uses GraphQL to enable components to declare the data they need.

Plugin

1. Install

npm install --save gatsby-plugin-typography typography **react-typography** typography-theme-kirkham gatsby-plugin-emotion @emotion/core

2. Add plugin to gatsby-config.js

gatsby-config.js

    module.exports = {
      siteMetadata: {
        title: `Pandas Eating Lots`,
      },
      plugins: [
        {
          resolve: `gatsby-source-filesystem`,
          options: {
            name: `src`,
            path: `${__dirname}/src/`,
          },
        },
        `gatsby-plugin-emotion`,
        {
          resolve: `gatsby-plugin-typography`,
          options: {
            pathToConfigModule: `src/utils/typography`,
          },
        },
      ],
    }
